page.title: 06VE DAY PLUS 40
page.content: {VE day}plus 40 was celebrated throughout Hertford on the{8th of May. { }At the Salisbury Arms Hotel ,the staff and management,invited people of the towns services for a party.They served boiled beef,carrots and beer at 10p a pint,as that was the price in the second word war.All the staff and management dressed in uniforms to serve the food and drink.Coloured bunting and a large banner decorated the outside of the hotel.Places were marked on ration cards and the menu was displayed on a page from the Daily Mirror of{VE day.}Among the guests were the Mayor and Mayoress of Hertford.The Mayor pulled the first pint of the special brew.The party was the idea of the Hotel Manager,Peter Broderick.
